org.jamwiki.utils

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamwiki.utils.Utilities

  • public abstract class Utilities
extends Object
    This class provides a variety of basic utility methods that are not dependent on any other classes within the org.jamwiki package structure.

      Utilities()

    • Method Detail

      • convertEncoding

        public static String convertEncoding(String text,
                                     String fromEncoding,
                                     String toEncoding)
        Convert a string value from one encoding to another.
        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be converted.
        fromEncoding - The encoding that the string is currently encoded in.
        toEncoding - The encoding that the string is to be encoded to.
        Returns:
        The encoded string.

      • decodeTopicName

        public static String decodeTopicName(String url,
                                     boolean decodeUnderlines)
        Decode a value that has been retrieved from a servlet request. This method will replace any underscores with spaces.
        Parameters:
        url - The encoded value that is to be decoded.
        decodeUnderlines - Set to true if underlines should be automatically converted to spaces.
        Returns:
        A decoded value.

      • decodeAndEscapeTopicName

        public static String decodeAndEscapeTopicName(String url,
                                              boolean decodeUnderlines)
        Decode a value that has been retrieved directly from a URL or file name. This method will URL decode the value and then replace any underscores with spaces. Note that this method SHOULD NOT be called for values retrieved using request.getParameter(), but only values taken directly from a URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The encoded value that is to be decoded.
        decodeUnderlines - Set to true if underlines should be automatically converted to spaces.
        Returns:
        A decoded value.

      • delimitedStringToList

        public static List<String> delimitedStringToList(String delimitedString,
                                                 String delimiter)
        Convert a delimited string to a list.
        Parameters:
        delimitedString - A string consisting of the delimited list items.
        delimiter - The string used as the delimiter.
        Returns:
        A list consisting of the delimited string items, or null if the string is null or empty.

      • encodeTopicName

        public static String encodeTopicName(String url)
        Encode a value for use a topic name. This method will replace any spaces with underscores.
        Parameters:
        url - The decoded value that is to be encoded.
        Returns:
        An encoded value.

      • encodeAndEscapeTopicName

        public static String encodeAndEscapeTopicName(String url)
        Encode a topic name for use in a URL. This method will replace spaces with underscores and URL encode the value, but it will not URL encode colons.
        Parameters:
        url - The topic name to be encoded for use in a URL.
        Returns:
        The encoded topic name value.

      • formatMessage

        public static String formatMessage(String key,
                                   Locale locale)
        Given a message key and locale return a locale-specific message.
        Parameters:
        key - The message key that corresponds to the formatted message being retrieved.
        locale - The locale for the message that is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A formatted message string that is specific to the locale.

      • formatMessage

        public static String formatMessage(String key,
                                   Locale locale,
                                   Object[] params)
        Given a message key, locale, and formatting parameters, return a locale-specific message.
        Parameters:
        key - The message key that corresponds to the formatted message being retrieved.
        locale - The locale for the message that is to be retrieved.
        params - An array of formatting parameters to use in the message being returned.
        Returns:
        A formatted message string that is specific to the locale.

      • getMapValueCaseInsensitive

        public static <V> V getMapValueCaseInsensitive(Map<String,V> map,
                                               String key)
        Utility method for retrieving a key from a map, case-insensitive. This method first tries to return an exact match, and if that fails it returns the first case-insensitive match.
        Parameters:
        map - The map being examined.
        key - The key for the value being retrieved.
        Returns:
        A matching value for the key, or null if no match is found.

      • getQueryString

        public static String getQueryString(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Utility method to help work around XSS attacks when executing request.getQueryString(). If the query string contains ", <, or > then assume it is malicious and escape.
        Parameters:
        request - The current servlet request.
        Returns:
        The request query string, or an escaped version if it appears to be an XSS attack.

      • getServerUrl

        public static String getServerUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Given a request, determine the server URL.
        Returns:
        A Server URL of the form http://www.example.com/

      • initializeLookupMap

        public static Map<String,String> initializeLookupMap(String... args)
        Initialize a hash map from a list of strings for use in lookups. The performance of a lookup against a hash map is superior to that of a list, so this approach is useful for critical-path lookups.

      • intersect

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> intersect(Map<K,V> map1,
                                       Map<K,V> map2)
        Utility method for determining common elements in two Map objects.

      • isIpAddress

        public static boolean isIpAddress(String ipAddress)
        Determine if the given string is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address. This method uses pattern matching to see if the given string could be a valid IP address.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - A string that is to be examined to verify whether or not it could be a valid IP address.
        Returns:
        true if the string is a value that is a valid IP address, false otherwise.

      • listToDelimitedString

        public static String listToDelimitedString(List<String> list,
                                           String delimiter)
        Convert a list to a delimited string.
        Parameters:
        list - The list to convert to a string.
        delimiter - The string to use as a delimiter.
        Returns:
        A string consisting of the delimited list items, or null if the list is null or empty.
